name: Air Canada Express New Livery Bombardier Q400 Landing and Takeoff at Calgary Airport
description:
I'm fairly sure this is the first individual Q400 video I've uploaded on this channel in a few years! The Q400 is extremely common in Calgary, so there's not much motivation to film them. Despite there being seven (at the time of uploading) being painted, Western Canada still hadn't seen them, up until a few days ago. Jazz Aviation, who operates them (along with CRJs) for Air Canada, has finally sent one out west, C-GIJZ, which is primarily operating regional flights within Western Canada from Calgary. Air Canada's new livery looks incredibly sharp on the Q400, and while there's no doubt that these birds will become incredibly common in the near future, I certainly won't be complaining! For now, while it's still a bit of a novelty, enjoy my first catch of the new Air Canada Express livery on the Bombardier Q400, arriving and departing Calgary International Airport, with ATC included.

Thanks for watching!

-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-

FLIGHT INFORMATION
Airline: Jazz Air (JZA/JZ)
Aircraft: De Havilland Canada DHC-8-402Q Dash 8 (DH8D)
Flight Number: JZA552 / JZA373
Aircraft Name: 425
Livery: 2017
Engines: 2x Pratt and Whitney Canada PW150A 
Registration: C-GIJZ
Route: Victoria (YYJ) - Calgary (YYC) - Fort McMurray (YMM)
Callsign: Jazz 552 / Jazz 373
Runway used: 17R / 17L
Date filmed: April 21, 2018
Local time: 1200
